questions.question_text_1: THIS IS QUESTION PAPER FOR THE SUBJECT "DEGREE LEVEL : COMPUTER SYSTEM DESIGNS (COMPUTER BASED EXAM)"  ARE YOU SURE YOU HAVE TO WRITE EXAM FOR THIS SUBJECT? CROSS CHECK YOUR HALL TICKET TO CONFIRM THE SUBJECTS TO BE WRITTEN.  (IF IT IS NOT THE CORRECT SUBJECT, PLS CHECK THE SECTION AT THE TOP FOR THE SUBJECTS REGISTERED BY YOU)
question_texts: THIS IS QUESTION PAPER FOR THE SUBJECT "DEGREE LEVEL : COMPUTER SYSTEM DESIGNS (COMPUTER BASED EXAM)"  ARE YOU SURE YOU HAVE TO WRITE EXAM FOR THIS SUBJECT? CROSS CHECK YOUR HALL TICKET TO CONFIRM THE SUBJECTS TO BE WRITTEN.  (IF IT IS NOT THE CORRECT SUBJECT, PLS CHECK THE SECTION AT THE TOP FOR THE SUBJECTS REGISTERED BY YOU)

questions.question_text_1: In a system with 16 unique states, 4 flip-flops are sufficient to represent all states.
question_texts: In a system with 16 unique states, 4 flip-flops are sufficient to represent all states.

questions.question_text_1: In a positive-edge-triggered D flipflop, if the D input is 1 and the clock signal transitions from low to high, Q output is 0.
question_texts: In a positive-edge-triggered D flipflop, if the D input is 1 and the clock signal transitions from low to high, Q output is 0.

questions.question_text_1: In a master-slave J-K flipflop, when J = 0 and K = 0, it toggles the flipflop’s state.
question_texts: In a master-slave J-K flipflop, when J = 0 and K = 0, it toggles the flipflop’s state.

questions.question_text_1: A POS expression does not translate to the optimized circuit implementation.
question_texts: A POS expression does not translate to the optimized circuit implementation.

questions.question_text_1: The set of gates AND, OR is logically complete as we can build a circuit to carry out the specification of any truth table we wish, using only these gates.
question_texts: The set of gates AND, OR is logically complete as we can build a circuit to carry out the specification of any truth table we wish, using only these gates.

questions.question_text_1: What is the minimum number of 4:1 multiplexers required to design a circuit that implements the function F(X,Y,Z) = (0,2,4,7). Assume X, Y, and Z as well as their complements to be available.
question_texts: What is the minimum number of 4:1 multiplexers required to design a circuit that implements the function F(X,Y,Z) = (0,2,4,7). Assume X, Y, and Z as well as their complements to be available.

questions.question_text_1: A circuit has three inputs (A, B and C) and a single output Y. Y is set to logic one if B is equals logic zero, otherwise Y is set to logic zero. What is the minimum number of minterms to be present in the POS expression for Y?
question_texts: A circuit has three inputs (A, B and C) and a single output Y. Y is set to logic one if B is equals logic zero, otherwise Y is set to logic zero. What is the minimum number of minterms to be present in the POS expression for Y?

questions.question_text_1: Consider a mod-14 down counter with an initial state of 0000. What will be the state of the counter after 29 clock pulses?
question_texts: Consider a mod-14 down counter with an initial state of 0000. What will be the state of the counter after 29 clock pulses?

questions.question_text_1: If we implement a simple memory array with 32-bit addressability and an address space size of 128, then what would be the total size of the memory (in bytes)?
question_texts: If we implement a simple memory array with 32-bit addressability and an address space size of 128, then what would be the total size of the memory (in bytes)?

questions.question_text_1: Let a processor contain 32 registers in its register file. Consider that the ALU is capable of performing 7 different operations: addition, subtraction, AND, NOT, XOR, XNOR,MOV. What is the minimum number of bits required by an instruction in order to perform XOR between two operands stored in the register file and then store the result in a separate register?
question_texts: Let a processor contain 32 registers in its register file. Consider that the ALU is capable of performing 7 different operations: addition, subtraction, AND, NOT, XOR, XNOR,MOV. What is the minimum number of bits required by an instruction in order to perform XOR between two operands stored in the register file and then store the result in a separate register?

questions.question_text_1: Perform 2’s complement subtraction of two number A = 12, B = 25. What is the result of A - B in 8-bit binary format? (Note: Don’t use sign magnitude form.)
question_texts: Perform 2’s complement subtraction of two number A = 12, B = 25. What is the result of A - B in 8-bit binary format? (Note: Don’t use sign magnitude form.)

questions.question_text_1: Which of the following Boolean functions can be used as a universal gate? Note: The boolean input zero and one are available.
question_texts: Which of the following Boolean functions can be used as a universal gate? Note: The boolean input zero and one are available.
